api_contracts.description: Returns a simple Hello World greeting message

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns Hello World response with timestamp

interfaces.description: Returns Hello World response with current timestamp
Formats response with message, status, and timestamp

component_logic.implementation_notes: Return fixed message 'Hello World' with status 'success' and current UTC timestamp in ISO 8601 format. Use datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z' for timestamp. No input validation needed since no parameters. Handle any exceptions and return 500 error.

design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: API contract must use GET method for /hello endpoint. Response must be JSON format with consistent structure.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify proper error response for server errors
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: API contract must define 500 error response. Component must handle exceptions and return appropriate error response.
Response must always include message, status, and timestamp fields. Message must be exactly 'Hello World'.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint has minimal processing overhead
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Handler should have O(1) complexity with no database calls or external API calls. Response generation should be under 1ms.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component follows single responsibility principle
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloWorldHandler must only handle /hello endpoint logic. No additional business logic or external dependencies.
Timestamp must be UTC in ISO 8601 format with 'Z' suffix. Use datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z' pattern.

architecture_overview: Simple single-endpoint REST API with minimal architecture. HelloWorldHandler component processes GET /hello requests and returns static Hello World message with current timestamp. No database, authentication, or external dependencies required. Stateless design with immediate response generation.
assumptions: No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
Response format includes timestamp for request tracking
Server timezone is irrelevant since UTC timestamps are used
No rate limiting needed for simple hello endpoint
No logging requirements beyond framework defaults
